comments.text: awesome spot. was heading south, but when I came to big sur, workers told me road is closed. fuck. had to come back, but spot is awesome
amazing place!
good spot, decent amount of traffic and plenty of space to pull over (heading south)
A very good place to hitchhike to south. I got a ride in 10 minutes to Big Sur.

Sweet place to hitch a ride south here. Took 10 minutes.

Caught a bus from Monterey transit center to here.
Great spot to catch ride to OKC in the morning.
Great spot to catch ride to OKC in the morning.
Lots of homebums but folks are willing to give rides. Turned down a ride from a trucker to Sanger 20 minutes before this.
Good place, a lot of car passing to north way. Near is a truck gas station.  I got a ride to Oklahoma in one hour.

I just want to comment that these spot reviews were for the gas station south of these coordinates, 35.2396, -111.6717 ☍

I hitched to the Grand Canyon there a dozen or so times with success. Wait times varied based on time of day, time of year, and number of people.
Shortest waits in the early morning hours! Very easy to get a ride directly to the canyon.
Perfect place for going to Grand Canyon
Take the 5 bus to its northernmost stop and walk out by the shell station. Good for going to the Grand Canyon, Snowbowl, and the junction.
I've used this spot successfully many times to get to Sedona and/or Phoenix.
Decent spot for getting down to Phoenix.
Elderly couple picked us up just before the hail started. Took us to Okemah where we had to shelter inside of Love's for a couple hours. They said be careful traveling through Oklahoma in May.
Not excessively busy, but a truck stop and took me all the way to Tennessee!
Lots of traffic, continuous. 3 cars stopped in 30 min.
Good spot to get onto I-40W. On-ramp with plenty of traffic, visibility and room to stop. Plus there's quite a places to eat and a Goodwill thrift store if you need some cheap stuff.
Got a ride to Pensacola from a fella who offered to let us borrow his gun for the evening
Nice ride to Pensacola in the back of a pickup with a fridge
Lucky ride all the way to Winter Park, just shy of Denver.
Ride from a mother and son who were going all the way to Casper.

Trucker from Chechnya took me a few hours north. Said he liked trucking for the first few months but now he's seen it all and it's just boring. Used to teach and tutor math back in Russia but had to leave last year. Nice guy, he smoked Parliaments and listened to grunge.

Trucker from Chechnya took me a few hours north. Said he liked trucking for the first few months but now he's seen it all and it's just boring. Used to teach and tutor math back in Russia but had to leave last year. Nice guy, he smoked  Parliaments and listened to grunge.

The spot is great, high visibility, massive shoulder --- big enough for a semi which is what eventually happened. Trucker took me all the way to Troy, just past St. Louis, blasting 80s and 90s country all the way and singing along. The AC in his cab didn't work and it was blistering out but when the rain started falling in central MO we just kept the windows wide open and let it wash us clean

The spot is great, high visibility, massive shoulder --- big enough for a semi which is what eventually happened. Trucker took me all the way to Troy, just past St. Louis, blasting 80s and 90s country all the way and singing along. The AC in his cab didn't work and it was blistering out but when the rain started falling in central MO we just kept the windows wide open and let it wash us clean

Local ride from an older lady and her daughter chainsmoking cigarettes and joints back to back all the way to Pryor Creek which was a little off my route but it got me to RT 69 which has a lot of traffic moving slow.

Local ride from an older lady and her daughter chainsmoking cigarettes and joints back to back all the way to Pryor Creek which was a little off my route but it got me to RT 69 which has a lot of traffic moving slow.

Cops chased me off the turnpike but I got a ride to the next town from a Mexican construction guy pretty easily here. The locals are friendly so it seems OK back roads are sometimes quicker to hitch than the interstates.

Cops chased me off the turnpike but I got a ride to the next town from a Mexican construction guy pretty easily here. The locals are friendly so it seems OK back roads are sometimes quicker to hitch than the interstates.
Got a ride before I put my thumb out. Dispensary owner who took me to the east end of Tulsa.
Got a ride before I put my thumb out. Dispensary owner who took me to the east end of Tulsa.
2guys, 25's, backpacks. Perfect !Heading north !
Hitched from a literal bear poacher named John Wayne. He was working as a pit toilet pumper. Most memorable hitch ever.

Regarding the Hotsprings: The guy at the entrance booth looked at me weirdly when I said I hitchhiked all the way there. Cameras are forbidden, but if you hide it at your arrival, they won't look for it. He also told me the owners won't like me asking around for a ride at the parking lot as it is private property.

Instead, I mentioned in the changing cabin I needed a ride back to town. Two women offered me a fun ride, where we exchanged about our worst&hilarious hitchhiking experience.

Was hitchhiking on the road, as few people seem stopping at the gas station nearby.
Suddenly, a Latino man made me a sign to come over. He offered me to drive me all the way through Kremmling. I accepted, and as I was waiting for him to fill gas and clean his windshield, I started discussing with the next-car man, Peter, who appeared to go to Steamboat Springs, my aim for the day. My original driver, hearing this, asked him if he could give me a ride. The new guy accepted.

Peter gave me an a

If you're in Taos, hang at the Ashram and talk to people ! There is a great sense of community there and people would be ready to help you out !

Met this old lady there who offered me a ride the day after to Alamosa, CO. 
we met in the morning, had a cup of Chai before heading North through the scenic NM 522. 
We got to talk about the US, her spiritual experiences, life in general. 
Arrived at Alamosa, she offered me lunch and then driving me even more North to increase traffic I'll encoun

Last gas station before hitting the Keys.

Got my ride from  a former NFL player, the 2nd or 3rd person I talked too. 

He originally was supposed to drop me at Islamorada, but as we befriended and shared a few drinks, he offered to drive me all the way to Key West, where we got more drinks. This drive really made my day !

Got into Sid's to get lunch before heading on the ramp. Nice cozy sandwich restaurant.

The couple owning the restaurant there have been marvelous. They offered me my lunch, a brownie for a snack and gave me a ride South to Buc-ee's to improve my chances to get a ride.

Marvelous and the kindest kind of people I met in this country, I can only recommend to hitchhikers to stop around and pay them a visit!
Quick ride from a cop in the back of the cruiser
Get out of Houston with bus 222, walk about two miles to this spot and wait on the side of the highway. Good church nearby to camp as well
Ride north with a cattle rancher
Got a ride hour up super quick
Got a ride to the next rest area going north , transit from Miami takes u all the way here
Not a lot of pull off room, but on 99 you don't have to worry too much.
Quick ride from two Mexican dudes going to Albany. One said he owned a taco truck in McMinnville.
Got a ride going around Mac from a lady going all the way to Lincoln City. Wish I was going to Lincoln City
99 is happy hitching in these parts
Great spot, wasn't even asking for a ride was just hanging out and someone came up and offered one to fort Lauderdale
Rest area , pretty busy, didn't have a hard time asking for a ride
Was flying a sign to make funds and someone offered a ride to cle elum. Bus picks up near Safeway and runs to ellensburg for free. Wasn't bad
Waited for an hour in the morning with another guy also hitchhiking.
Quick ride to Ontario from a guy who was missing his thumb.
Tons of traffic in the morning. Got a ride to Caldwell pretty quick.
Bemused Mexican man drove me out to Jerome.
Trucker from Kyrgyzstan took me all the way to the 80/84 split east of Salt Lake.

Long wait for a ride to Wyoming. Turned down three people who were going towards Denver. It's tough with the road splitting like that, but it seems like there's a good amount of folks going either way. Finally got a guy who was headed to Fort Collins so dropped me off in Cheyenne.
Short wait for a ride all the way to Big Springs. Nebraska really thins out once. you're west of Kearney.
Nice spot, lots of shoulder for cars.
Super friendly to hitchhikers, got a ride in no time. A ton of professors and writers up here. The specifics spot I got picked up was bad I think, I am guess my success had more to do with the area
Lot's of Streetlamps, so night hitching is worth a shot. Got a ride another hour west.
Dude was just going to Waterman but took me all the way to I-39 junction.
Good traffic light. Got a ride from a guy coming back from a big casino loss. Plenty of gambling in Illinois, it seems.

Low traffic and a long wait but most people heading east from here are going to Texas. I got a lift from two recent A&M grads going a few hours into west Texas. Stopped once in Amarillo where they bought me a cheeseburger. Happy hitching out here
Great spot to get out of CS -- but beware of rides going only as far as Pueblo :/
Great spot but I would wait longer for a ride past town next time. I took the first offer this time and it landed me at a much worse onramp downtown.
Easy spot to catch a ride into Denver. Beautiful drive coming down the mountain on 40 and then 70
Good shot of getting down to Rock Springs from here
Ride from a guy commuting to Jackson area. Chill people both sides of the state line
Just walking along the road, got an early lift from an old excavator guy with sideburns. He excavates but he also elevates, in some sense.

Hitched from the signpost, with a pack and a dog. Got a ride within 3 minutes. Ride went a few towns out of their way and into the national forest to get me exactly to where i was going. Local bus will get you most of the way there from town.

Great spot to leave the valley heading south, I have started trips to Tucson from here. It is 5 miles south of the nearest bus stop, so requires a little walking or a ride, but worth it to catch the reservation traffic.
Great spot for heading toward Rocky Mountain National Park.
Long wait but got a ride all the way to Dallas!
Got us over the bridge into Louisiana.
Good breakaway point to try and get east.
Guy took us all the way to Jackson and bought us a motel room.
quick ride from a Christian man. Lots of people prayed over us in Mississippi
Looking for a ride here
Great spot for going east. Lots of people going to Boston, the Berkshires, and Maine. I got picked up by a Geocacher who took me all the way to my friends place in Boston.

flight landed, rushed outside to beat fellow passengers on plane just in case any of them could pick me up, get to loading zone sidewalk n stick thumb out, timer doesn't even hit a minute until this guy pulls up and asks where I'm headed
Lucked out with a ride from a trucker. He was going all the way to St. Louis and put us up in Tupelo MS for the night.
Momentum!
Navy guy in a pickup truck took us all the way to Norfolk.
Couple of roofing guys picked us up in a Box truck. Took us to the Maryland border.
Ride to Millsboro with a guy who was Doordashing. Said he wanted to touch sand in Thailand someday.
Was just about to quit thumbing for the day when a Nissan Cube pulled over. Took us all the way to Magnolia, south of Dover, and dropped us at a good golf course to camp out.
Quick ride to West Haven from a guy that used to drive professionally.
Short ride but they gave us Blueberry muffins and weed.

Immediately after the cops left, an elderly couple pulled over and drove us a few miles down the road, arguing the whole way about where to drop us off so we had the best chance of getting to Connecticut. Eventually they decided on the onramp near Richmond.
Easy hitching across the bridge.

Didn't wait long at this spot but it took us hours of public transit maneuvering and walking to get here. Fall River does not seem to have a reliable bus system. It felt great to finally just hitch a ride.
Bit of a wait but lots of waves and smiles. Got a ride from a guitar player heading to Mass. for a gig. She offered to stop at Kerouac's grave with us in Lowell.
Ride from a local guy with a thick Maine accent.
Girl from the college saw us, walked over and offered to drive us off the island.
Guy pulled over who was just going into Bellows Falls for a drink. We decided to join and then went for pizza too. Then he offered to drive us all the way to Portland in the dead of night.
Ride to the interstate from an 82 year old man who builds pipe organs and writes songs. He yodeled for us a bit during the drive.
A dude with a fresh fish business took us to the edge of town.
Quick ride up to Albany. Dropped us at the start of I-187.
Halfheartedly hitching at sunset. Got a ride from a woman who took us to a bar in Kingston. Bartender let us crash at her Airbnb for the night. Everything works out one way or another.
Guy wasn't going anywhere and offered to drop us off a few minutes up the road. A few minutes turned into an hour and he took us all the way to New York.
Interstate was closed that morning, which was good for us because all the traffic had to detour on the slower, back road. Got a quick ride going a few hours east.
Caught a ride all the way to State College. Older guy insisted on taking us all the way, though he was only headed to Lewistown.
Not long on the freeway in WV. Got a ride back to I-81. They were going all the way to Virginia Beach but we were headed farther north.
Quick ride from a very nice elderly couple. Stopped at a thrift store on the way up to Lewisburg.
Guy that picked us up had no clue what hitchhiking was. Thought we were trying to walk to Pennsylvania.
Got picked up by a guy obsessed with Trikes.
Pretty good hitching along 460 here. A lot of outdoor recreation types.
Good spot, has a few spots to eat and a gac station..
Ride from a hiker girl to DT Asheville.
Quick local ride. Guy gave us beer and took us a couple exits.
Cool ride from a woman who'd just gotten Carpel Tunnel surgery and had us change the gears for drive and park.
Easy hitching in this part of North Carolina. Locals are super friendly. Short rides but quick.
Lots of traffic. National parks are easy. Got a ride from a Danish woman. We discussed hitchhiking in Europe, Christianity, her gay son's underwater-halloween themed wedding, and other things.
Picked up immediately in the morning by 65 yr old couple who took us home gave us tequila shots and some weed and jammed a little bit then got us over to the Park Visitors center.
Friendly people in rural Tennessee. Weren't doing anything, drove us all the way to Cookeville.
Turned down a couple quick ride offers into town. Finally a trucker stopped going all the way to Brownsville. He ended up buying us a motel room for the night which was very kind.
Got a ride from a guy at the light. Happy hitching in Arkansas!
Great ride from a super country dude. Couldn't understand a word he said but he smoked us out and kept up a lively conversation.
Couple farm guys saw the cop drop us off at the county line and offered to take us almost to Viola.
Nice ride from a woman headed to Mountain Home Taco Bell.
Great ride through Harrison. Guy bought us McDonald's and then blessed it before eating.

Long wait in the early morning. Short ride from construction guys. Alpena has a great park for stealth camping. You can go to the east side of the park by the river and there is a sandy bank with just enough room for a small tent.
Good shoulder, uphill. Got a good ride to the Walmart outside Huntsville. Coming on sunset in the Ozarks.
Quick ride from a couple of college girls headed up to Fayetteville.

After we finally walked to our spot, we got a ride from a mother and son headed all the way to Branson, MO for a bluegrass festival. We got off in Van Buren, not yet realizing that we were bound north for Fayetteville and not east for Little Rock.
Local Pastor took us to Shoney's but warned us "Shoney's will hurt you"
Short rides in OK
Lots of long distance traffic, good visibility and easy for cars to stop.  Probably can hitch to anywhere in eastern MA from here with some patience.

A kind driver named Andrew pulled over when he saw my sign for I78-West Harrisburg. I was flying my sign at the intersection. 

He wasn't able to get me all of the way there, but got me close enough to get another ride.

Walked down Malone/Jagoe w/ my thumb out, cloudy weekday. Dude in a truck saw me hitching and flipped around after and drove me all the way to Willis Library. Talked about music. Ave C is generally pretty good either way, bc people are always headed to or from UNT, but there did seem to be more traffic going North, so I had to walk south a bit to catch more neighborhood traffic. April 2025

Got a ride here today & yesterday. Yesterday, I was given a ride to a parking lot from this spot, but it wasn't significant enough of a distance to add. Today, I got a ride from a Cop here who drove me all the way to Carroll. Daytime for both, there's a really nice place for cars to pull in right next to Crumley. Someone also told me today that if I ever was hitchhiking bc I was stuck, I should go ask her for help & she showed me where her office was. Cop said ppl hitch sometimes to get across c

Was at a pretty good spot to pull over on North Texas, and started walking and hitching before a dude walking behind me offered me a ride, so I walked w him to his car. Gave me a ride to University. Pedestrians give a lot of rides in Denton

Pretty good spot for hitching from a funnel by construction, could've taken the ride all the way to Sanger. Lots of Denton ppl are from Sanger. They circled back around and said they watched me for a bit but then decided I wasn't dangerous cuz I was smiling and near a college

Got a ride from UNT students from the Middle East, they picked me up just after the bus station area near the Union and drove around to Bonnie Brae where they dropped me at UC Denton. Good hitching spot, as students tend to be leaving. Happy Thumbin!

Sunset ride on April 1st- got picked up by a group of 3 teenagers that took me along with them to several locations around Rayzor Ranch including Walmart. They dropped me at the Starbucks near Rayzor Ranch, but offered to take me further, or where I needed to go. Offered me alc, among other things also. Hitching northbound on Bonnie Brae, there's a good spot for pulling over into the 7/11 parking lot. Also, a good spot to see the sunset & either get rides North or either way on University.  - Be

Hickory is great for thumbing during weekdays when UNT has classes. I got picked up here by a student who offered to drive me right to the music building.   Great places to pull over between streets & near the bike lanes.
Great place to hitch on a weekday afternoon.
Technically not hitchicking, we got a ride from somebody we met on the lift at Palisades Tahoe.
2guys, 25's, backpacks. Got a ride from sb going to ski. Perfect
2guys, 25's, backpacks. Helped that girl to put on her chains and got a ride to Incline village. She asked to meke sure we were not serial killers. We said no, it was ok :D
2guys, 25's, backpacks. Decent spot to pull over. Close enough to the end of the bus line. Impec !
2guys, 25's, backpacks. Low traffic but first car took us ! Easy !
2guys, 25's, backpacks. Perfect !
2guys, 25's, backpacks. GOod visibility, good room to stop, good people, good spot !
2guys, 25's, backpacks. Got picked up quickly by a local cowboy. Did not go that far but good and super friendly.
2ppl, 25's. Got a ride pretty quickly asking somebody who stopped there to look at the view. We had out hicking backpacks. We jumped in the pack of their pickup truck.
Rest area is the best. PEople here still though we were bums, but were nice. You are likely to find long rides there.
Shoulder on the on ramp with enough space to stop. Got a ride to Richmond.
Good spot on the on ramp with enough space to stop.
Got a ride pretty much before we could even put down the backpacks. We tried a bit the nearby petrol station before but it was rather empty.
Just a bit after the park entry. Got a ride before we even fished a sign to Washington D.C.. Probably good to ask for rides at the parking as well. 4km walk to a free camp site in the river from here
Up the road is a nice green area, good for stealth camping. Got a ride down towards the River whee we went to the free campsite. Good spot at a crossing with traffic lights
The gas station people by this on ramp are cool just don't cause a scene. If quiet and clean up, you can sleep behind the building next to the tracks
I probably got picked up because it was getting dark, but it was very quick, I was surprised, as it's a pretty small exit

Great spot for hitching north from Anchorage; have done it many times. Usually get to Wasilla, sometimes Willow and other times as far as Denali National Park. There is a little bus pullout right on the highway after the stop light. Many people are just starting to speed up, but not always going too fast, so you should get a ride if you look good. I would suggest a sign here.
I still need to go what the hell is this website. GET ME OUT OF HERE!!!!!!!!1
Easy long rides east or west with truckers. Be friendly and don't piss off the workers
Very friendly town towards HHers. Got a ride to Odessa, TX.
got a ride immediately and it was first driver who have met me on a road, so i’m impressed, really strong community down there
got a ride less in 5 minutes! have not went far, but still really good!!
just a nice spot near a really good view
Not a ton of pullover room but very slow traffic and a lot of positive vibes. Got a ride all the way to George from a woman headed to a Bob Dylan/Willie Nelson/Billie Strings concert
Seems like the best spot if you want to get out of Seattle. You can take busses all the way to downtown Issaquah, then it's a short walk to this onramp.
Good visibility. Took 20 minutes maybe less for a ride to Walsenburg. The guy was a tattoo artist going all the way to Denver in his van. Listening to American Beauty.
Great shoulder, visibility, quick ride to Buena Vista around sunset.
Quick ride to Fresco transit center. Busses can be very helpful getting situated down on I-70.
First ride in Colorado, gave us weed and trail-mix!
Long wait but you can't complain with the scenery. Saw some antelope on the drive when we finally got a ride. Listening to West Coast rap.
Easy hitching on these roads. Ride to Riverside, almost to Colorado. People may assume that you're hiking the CDT.
First car picked us up. It's the kind of remoteness where that can happen. Girl from Georgia on a cross-country odyssey was shunpiking to Laramie.
Good spot, but not a lot of traffic. Started on the on ramp and caught a ride just after starting to walk down to the freeway.
Ride from a couple all the way to Rock Springs. Got us through the endless sagebrush and bought us McDonald's.
Got a ride to Pinedale from a dude coming back from a Yellowstone goat hunt.
Slow traffic but beautiful.
Great spot. Guy who didn't speak any English brought us a few miles down the road and then turned around.
Good spot. Got a sympathy ride once the rain started coming down a little harder. Took us to the next junction and out of the rain.
Took us all the way to Jackson
Quick ride to old faithful with two guys headed from SD --> CA in their van. Got picked up by them again after the geyser went off.
Hit the road at sunrise. Got a ride into the park from a couple of construction guys.
Easy hitching south out of Livingston. Got a ride from an off-duty cop from Salem, OR.
Slightly sketchy spot because of construction. Got picked up pretty quick by a couple of 19 year olds from Coeur d'Alene headed to Billings.
Great visibility, shoulder. Got a ride from a chill dude with wild huckleberries and a dog named Porter. He let us crash at his place for the night and dropped us off at the on ramp bright and early.

Not long before a Semi pulled over. Unfortunately he had to drop us off after a couple miles because of the weigh station. Weigh station turned out to be closed but it was too late. Trucker was a cool guy from Kyrgyzstan.
Nice ride from a guy who gave us a driving tour of Coeur D'Alene. A beautiful little town, though crawling with cops.
There is a sign past this point, that says no pedestrians past this point. This is a good spot.
Folks here are pretty chill
Pretty much the only option in Fillsmore but it's good. Visible, place to stop, people going far after gas break.
Good spot but bushes might make it harder. But otherwise people see you for about 20-30 seconds because of speed limit and ramp. And there is a nose spot to cars to stop there also.
Just was sitting outside and read a book. And I have a sign on my backpack, so everyone can see where I'm going. So I think I was looks polite and that's why someone gave me a ride to Georgetown!

Its my 2nd time within 2 weeks, but now I'm heading south, bc Indiana its big pain in the ass to hitchhike there. So now its even easier bc so many people go to Columbus. I was just sitting outside and reading with my sign (KY) and a random guy picked me up

Wasn't even hitchhiking but walking on a road (I have a cardboard sign on a front side of my backpack so people will see where I coking every time) and a random guy picked me up not far, but it works. But maybe I'm again a lucky bitch today
I was trying to stay up higher, but is way too many cars there. So I decided go down for a bit and it 2as successful. Less traffic, more visibility, good ride
Just do not stand under the "emergency stops only" sighn, but on the road. People will stop on red and they will have more time to see you. That how I actually got a ride from there.
Nice spot without so many warnings at the ramp as usual. I think people could give me a long ride, but I was surprised how fast it was and took a really short one to Amherst.
I love Vermont. Even next to a cemetery people will pick you up and help you
Not many people there, but mostly they wants to help even if they are going in opposite (or they just a fakers) I was headed west, not far, but still useful
Just thumb out for fun with no expectation and the BOOM less than a 5 minutes baby
Small town with small people with huge hearth
Quite few people there, but nice spot a bit after a corner
Excellent spot. Near a gas station. Two routs spleet, nice traffic.
People are really kind and welcome there! Got second ride in this area and it took less than a 10 minutes!
People are really kind there. I asked for water in local store and they gave to me for free!! And got a ride really quickly (or I'm just lucky)

I arrived shortly after 8 am, waited right next to the truck exit and was told by security that he couldn't say anything if I was flying behind the gate (on the sidewalk). Held a sign out and got a trucker offer me a ride in under an hour and a half headed to Omaha.

Was insanely lucky, didn't even have to wait. Had been dropped off by the Catholic priest (see near Breaux Bridge) and was walking along the highway to the next intersection. A truck on the ramp honks at me and pulls up for me to hop in. Big Texan called Brandon - really cool and generous

Very good spot for getting picked up. Had just hopped out some freak's car (see red dot near Cullman, Al) and had a sob story. Asked around for a lift, was offered money and got a lift from a friendly trucker to Birmingham

Very lucky to get a ride at this spot, but defo a good location. A trucker called Ali pulled up to check his tyres and let me in when I asked him. Very nice guy too. Decent shade, and was dropped off by a veteran hitcher there, very good spot

Very sunny spot, no shade whatsoever. Next to a truck stop so plenty of room on the on ramps to pull over. Traffic was very scarce so I thought it'd be a whole, but the first trucker to pull in picked me up. Probably felt bad about the heat. In a pinch probable wouldn't be a bad place to highway walk (if you don't get any rides) Doesn't seem like there was a police presence nearby at all.

Caught a ride as I was writing the sign. Guy pulled over going straight to West Palm. There's enough room for cars to pull over, but they are coming in fast, so higher vis-signs are better than thumbs in my opinion.

Got there around 6/7, one hour-ish to sunset with a sign. Ample pull off space and placed right next to two large stuck stops. Traffic was really slow here, mostly trucks driving past. Got a ride with a trucker within 10 minutes of flying a sign going to Chicago. I'm a young female, which may have affected things, but 10/10 for this spot.

I have left from this spot SO many times. Best way to go North out of the valley. Take the lightrail all the way east to Gilbert Rd. Take the Gilbert Rd bus (doesn't run Sundays) all the way north. Walk about two more miles to where Gilbert road ends. Guaranteed rides, no cop harassment. Everyone is going at least to Fountain Hills, a good half the traffic is heading to Payson or beyond. I have started trips to Flagstaff, Payson, Chinle, Moab, Las Vegas, Santa Fe, and more from this spot. Worth

I've hitchhiked here many times over the years heading towards Laughlin or Las Vegas. Usually pretty quick, once got a ride from a guy going to Tahoe and just rolled with it. Great spot if you can get here.
Couple of Mexican guys got me all the way to Mt. Angel.
Wide shoulder. A dude from Spain took me to Redmond.
Picked up in a van by a very cool couple returning to Oregon after several months on the road. Took me all the way to Mitchell. 26 is a gorgeous road through the Ochocos!
Good spot to hitch to get back to the AZT
Take the PVTA bus from Northampton if westbound. This section of route  9 is easy. I've  hitched it many many  times.
Not a spot by the road. It is Lisa's truck stop. Very nice staff. Didnt kick me out for asking around
Walk here if you're dropped in Big Spring. Locals don't pick up at all but the rest area works well.
Quick ride, good spot
I started out early in the morning, and did alright.
I had a sign and before I stepped foot on the on-ramp somebody stopped and took me to Pueblo.
This spot isn't bad. All the other north bound ramps in town were closed when I came through so there was plenty of traffic. There is a lot of room for traffic to pull off.
This spot is pretty good. There is lots of traffic and room for traffic to pull off.
Get out of the town from here.
Great spot to get towards Denver!
Monday morning not good but probably an ideal spot at other times.
Got a short ride to Newberg. Pretty easy spot so it may be worth it to find a ride going further.
Very wide shoulder. Got a ride all the way.

Wide shoulder, great spot. Public transit in Corvallis is free and quick. You can get to a good spot to hitch out fairly quickly on any of the highways. Wide shoulder on 99, I got a ride up to Adair Village from a nice grandma.
I have been picked up here twice and taken a few towns over.. lots of traffic and a lot of people heading in both directions

I have been picked up here several times going in both directions so has my 
boyfriend
Good spot. Slow traffic, wide shoulder. World Famous pies at the shop right there off the highway.
Lots of space, traffic isn't going too fast, maybe 45 mph. Got picked up by a nice old log truck driver who dropped me off at the exact beach I was aiming for north of Garibaldi.
Picked up as soon as I stuck my thumb out. Ride to the 101 Junction.
Lots of pull off room, didn't have to wait long. Most traffic doesn't seem to be local so hitching from the center of town was no problem.
I took transit out to a nearby truck stop. Walked out to the on ramp and got picked up right away.

I was hitching Southbound, directly from the highway. There is a huge gravel pad for traffic to pull off. There is a truck stop (Petro) near by.

I got picked up by a big rig and got a ride all the way to Dallas, TX.
good hitching south from here
good hitching north from here
Casual Carpool Workdays 6-9AM
Was able to hop a train down to Miami from this spot. Solo run, but the area was a hopper spot. Could see signs of other jumpers.
This whole stretch after the curve has wide shoulders, except the bridge. I stood after the bridge near the speed limit sign and didn't have to wait very long.
Good spot to go north took ~15 minutes to find someone to take us up the coast
Nice spot to go north West out of santa cruz
Generous shoulder, pull off spots, gas stations, windblown cardboard. Hitchhiking bonanza.
Had three ride offers in the span of thirty minutes here!
Hitch Hike around town, surrounds areas, and up the 1.  Everyone hitches
Good spot, you're easily visible and there's shadow in the afternoon.
Great spot to go south. Plenty of room to pull over. Cars are going against a hill, so they naturally slow down a bit.
Lots of amenities so nice place to hang out and wait. You're gonna  have to go around asking to find a ride. Lots of traffic going west, not much going south. Got a ride to kingston
5 min wait. direction WEST

Stood there for about 3 hours in the rain asking people in the gas station and truck drivers for a ride on the 81 South towards Knoxville. After 3 hours got an insane ride all the way to Nashville. If you plan on hitchhiking here keep in mind that: most truckers nowadays are not allowed by their company to pick you up and that about 9 out of 10 people there are heading up North and not down South
Two huge truck stops on either side of the road. Good place to get rides on both directions on I-81 or on I-66. Just stand with a sign with the road name and direction, or ask around with drivers.
if you stand in the triangle by the northbound on-ramp drivers don't have much room to stop, the overpass shoulder might be a better option. got an early morning ride to eugene after waiting 3 hrs
This is probably the best northbound spot for Ashland. The onramp is steeply sloped and difficult for trucks, but there's plenty of room for cars to pull over and steady traffic of friendly people.
Could have waited longer, but overall a very good spot. The Jarrell truck stop is a Flying J, so nice showers and you won’t get employees sicced on you.

This is very good spot for long ride. Here are a lot of trucks and if you stay on this corner some body will pick you up. But don't go for short ride. It is better to stay longer here. I  in one hour catch bus for free to Dallas, but declined two short offer before it.

Man stopped on ramp as I was still walking and offered me a ride. 
Very sympathic.
Good spot !, Not crazy traffic but traffic

2ppl, 25's, Good spot, room to stop. cars going straight often go too fast to stop but it is great to catch ppl entering the highway. The have to stop due to traffic and have time to decide to pick you up. We got a ride straight to Tucson

Got a ride from a UNT student to the Environmental Science building before he went to go park. Ride was super short. Hickory has good spots to pull over & shade during the day. From the beginning of my ride before until the end of this ride, the elapsed time was not even 10 minutes.

Met a cool dude while I waited & got a ride in a Motorcycle from a UNT student. He didn't have pegs so I got my legs burned a little bit but it was awesome.   Generally, during the day on Weekdays, there are many students traveling on Hickory to school at UNT. I just grabbed on. Hickory also has great spots for cars (and bikes) to pull over

The third car that passed offered to take me anywhere I needed to go. He was coming home from work & was from South India (Andhra Pradesh), I decided to get off on Scripture & Ave C, where I didn't get a ride & just walked.   This wasn't a great spot in terms of pulling over, but there's lots of grass & the road is only one lane.
Walked most of the way. Hitching seems to be pretty good on campus though.

Pretty good spot, Hitching south on the ramp to I65. Got a ride from a local truck driver before dark ! 
But dropped off in a shitty location.
Good area with lots of room to escape to, emergency (field) camping outside town. Turned down a few rides here due to not being long enough but found one eventually.
There is a clear line of sight. Tons of room for folks to pull off, and there is a lot of traffic. Folks seem pretty friendly.
Lot of traffic , got a ride an hour west to Springfield

Lots of services. About five miles away from the Framingham MBTA stop but there's a free bus that'll take you most of the way there. Trucks and cars headed west on I-90 or south to I-84. Got picked up in five minutes by a trucker headed west and he dropped me off at a rest stop in CT which is one of the last good places for truckers to stop in the area.

Stand at the intersection NW of the bus stop. Great spot to hitch a ride up to any of the mountains, especially if you’re holding your skis/snowboard. I’ve done this multiple times and never waited longer than half an hour, best to be there as early as possible
update...i'm thinking the spot down south, broadway@greenbriar...is better
leaving boulder towards golden. very easy. no problems.

Tried to get a ride at 6pm and no luck, spent the night at the playground nearby. The sprinklers turn on at 12 and go all night, I was fine sleeping in the amphitheater. 

Woke up the next morning @ 7 and got picked up after 30 min ride to Spokane
Super low evening traffic but good visibility and shoulder. We ended up walking on the freeway. Eventually got a ride from a computer sales guy coming home from Seattle.
There is a truck stop near by so there was a decent amount of traffic. Good visibility, and lots of room to pull off
Half hour wait at dawn for a ride up to Layton.
depending on the day and weather, you can land a ride fairly quickly, 45 minutes or less.  the police have never stopped me and I've hitched here a number of times heading to Logan.
Tons of cars going North on I-15, lots of space on the on-ramp.  Less then 15 minutes wait.

Should be a great spot. Plenty of room for cars to stop and see you. But I waited here for 5 hours and couldn't get a ride. I was dressed nice, had a sign that said "Memphis". I'm wondering if only locals use this ramp as of 2025

Very busy ramp, gas stations and restaurants all around. Apparently this ramp has been used by a lot of hitchhikers and tramps, as the guardrail is covered in signatures and hitchhiking tips by people who have tried there before. One even says that if you're hungry, you can walk to Waffle House and get a whole menu for free. 
I got a ride after 1 hour, and the driver even took me out for lunch.

If you're hitching out west out of Nashville, consider investing your time walking to this spot rathe

25's. Got a really hard time here, but finally got a ride to Knoxville. 
I was there too late I guess (8:30AM). After the time for people to go to work. I was also there the day before at dark, but it was probalby too late either.
I got a ride to Corbin, KY
Excellent spot to hit I-75 south. Berea is  a very liberal town and you're most likely to be taken for a student from the local college.
Really good spot, good traffic, good visibility, good area to pull over. Got my ride halfway to Atlanta from there

I've hitched out of here many times going west and its my fav spot for westbound. My wait has been 3 minutes to 1.5 hours. Its high visibility and has a place for folks to pull over. Gas stations and fast food nearby for cardboard and shelter.
I-40 West On-ramp. Not easy to get to by transit or walking, but a great place to hitch west.
Got very lucky and picked up immediately

I was a little worried about this spot. It's such a small town. However I was only there for 30 minutes before someone picked me up. It seems there's a lot of people going this way to go to the Grand Canyon and other outdoorsy things in southern Utah and northern Arizona.
me gusta este lugar es muy bien
good place. 20 min wait. saturday 7 pm
Good spot, first hitching experience, smiled a lot and got multiple offers til I found the car headed as far as I wanted to go
It's a pretty fast road, but the visibility is good and the shoulder is huge.

North out of Eugene, this is your spot. Walk far enough down so you can get both the slow cars coming on the ramp, and allow for anyone on the I-5 to stop if they feel like it. Tons of stopping space. Have a big sign. We got picked up almost immediately.

It's legal to stand by the freeway in Oregon, so you can catch the cars merging off Beltline Road here; there's a big shoulder for them to pull into and they aren't going too fast yet.  The through traffic on I-5 is going too fast to stop.

Wide highway shoulder with good sightlines. Between Oxnard and San Luis Obispo it is suburbia so rides are spare. If you are financially able, take the Amtrak to 
SLO. You will save food money and time by doing so.
Lots of rich cars from Malibu & Santa Monica who won't pick up anyone. But then again sometimes they do :)
Best way out of LA. Follow the advice for LA on the wiki.
This is a pretty good spot to get as far as Ventura, plus the 1 along the coast has pretty wide shoulders all the way up to Oxnard.
I waited on the other side at the Chevron , seems like more ppl going west from there

Nice place to ask for rides going either direction and any distance.  I've hitched into L.A., to Palm Springs and to Phoenix from here.  There are two east bound onramps, so asking is probably more efficient than thumbing it.
There's now also a big truck stop down the street. Stood around asking for rides at night got one to the next exit, took it for shits. Locals are friendly though

Good place to get rides on I-81, both south and north. There's a Liberty gas station, with a few trucks. Stand with a sign in the station's exit or ask around with drivers. If you came on I-66 to I-81 south, and the driver was going north, this is a good option to get the next ride south.
People are driving a little fast, but good for all Santa Fe traffic & near Gas. Public transit not available early Sunday morning

I-25 north and south traffic enters highway off this road. Medium amount of traffic with a Giant gas station nearby. Heading south, find a safe spot to stand close to this location. Thumbing north (CO), walk along S. St Francis Dr, under the overpass, and hold sign or thumb before cars veer to the right to enter highway.
Not such good a spot anymore as the highway is closed. Took the 110 to Pacifica
road closed as it was too windy -  kinda too close to town as well. took my about an hour to get a lift to half-moon bay
Got a ride south to Santa Cruz in less than three minutes!
Not a lot of room to pull over but it works! Got a ride in 15 minutes
Going north. I believe I was particularly lucky at this spot because I got a ride almost immediately. Still, it's got a good set-up because of multiple traffic lights and gas stations.
Ride all the way to Rockford from a Cuban guy driving a box truck all the way from Houston to Wisconsin.
Ride all the way to Rockford from a Cuban guy driving a box truck all the way from Houston to Wisconsin.

Long wait but a local guy finally stopped. Told me about how he didn't look both ways at the traintrack once last year and his truck got hit and everything was destroyed except for him. Said he used to drive 100 mph all the way to Chicago to go see his girlfriend back in the 70s.

Long wait but a local guy finally stopped. Told me about how he didn't look both ways at the traintrack once last year and his truck got hit and everything was destroyed except for him. Said he used to drive 100 mph all the way to Chicago to go see his girlfriend back in the 70s.
~20 minutes to El Granada the spot has enough space for people to turn off, cars are moving fast and many cars but good spot overall
idk why is everyone tryied to find a ride way up, Where i stayed it much closer to traffic light so traffic is slow there and people see you better
Took five minutes on a Friday during ski season. Took five hours on a Saturday in June.

Great for getting "down the hill."  You don't even need a sign; just stick out your thumb and wait ... however waiting time could be up to 1 hour.  Don't look like a bum here.  A sign that says "LA" might help.

Got good traffic heading North, a gas station and large shoulder. 

My driver was a rancher on his way to the library, accepted to bring me to the edge of the city. Quite silent.

Easy way to go to Helena, straight line, you can't be missed by drivers. 

A delivery man who already saw me in Bozeman earlier that day picked me up. We did one stop to deliver some axles before he dropped me in town where I asked him to.

Good spot with a good flow of cars. Not much stop at the gas station, but the place offers all kind of amenities for the wait.

After only a few minutes, almost got a ride to Bozeman, MT, but the couple changed their mind.

Finally, a young guy who moved recently in MT from CA picked me up and give me a ride in a mix of music and thoughts over life and religion.

Got a ride as I just installed myself on the pavement to panhandle and keeping an eye on the gas station.

Paige was a nurse on her way to work. She offered to host me in case I end up stuck in the area for the rest of the day.

Gas station was full when I got dropped. Time to go to the restroom and grab a lunch snack, it was empty. Panhandle on the side of the road.

A Mormon man appeared and offered me a ride. Nice, he told me a bit about the story of the area. He offered me a chocolate mint protein bar and a bottle of water.

Forgot my phone in the previous car, had to go back to Craig to pick it up. Once I secured my previous driver was aware of me coming back, I basically waved at any car going East in sense of emergency.
The second one pulled over and picked me up.

Gas station with a big parking lot. Not many cars stopping there, but lots of traffic driving between Black Hawk & the Interstate, both ways.
Straight line who allows visibility, however cars driving fast, less encline to stop.

Got a ride from a retired man from Minnesota, who is now a poker dealer. On his way back home after working for a tournament in BH, he wasn't in a hurry and drop me where he thought would be the more convenient to keep heading West.

Big shoulder, but very windy that day and no shelter.

Got a ride from a woman going home after skiing who dropped me only a few miles south as she was going through CO72. 
Offered me her hand warmers she just activated as they were useless to her now.

Walked with thumb up and a sign from Broadway&Boulder Canyon Dr intersection, as there was already someone panhandling there.

No real shoulder along the way. Someone eventually pulled out on his way to the ski resort and gave me a ride all the way there.

Was taking a snack before heading to get the bus to reach Boulder.

Start talking with my soon-to-be driver.
I looked too tired apparently, so she offered me a ride.
Had much fun with her, we hanged out in the following days and she became a friend!
wide shoulder, good people watching - a bit sketchy to get to. traffic light a bit north of pin is helpful for slowing down traffic.

Great spot, good traffic.
Cars see you from far away, place to pull over and they're forcedto slow down bc of the town. 
The general store seemed like a good place to take a rest.

Got a ride from Justin, nice old man who gave me an authentic Western vibe !
Got a ride from an old local on his way home to Holman, he offered to drop me further. He left me at the county limit in the middle of nowhere. Breathtaking scenery though.

Amazing place to stop. Little traffic as the end of the day.

I was about to give up when my driver stopped.

Former hitchhiker with his son, lots of nice stories shared.

Highly recommend NM-104 road for the scenery, breathtaking !

Got a ride from the first person I asked, a young Mexican on his way to work.

He ended up inviting me for lunch. 

We had a long conversation about how he encountered God through the Bible and became a predicator and how his life changed.

Nice gas station. Got my lunch spontaneously paid by someone in front of me in the line and people I asked a ride were very friendly.

A young man heading to Houma with his van picked me up, after first telling me it couldn't, due to a common misunderstanding. Being on a rush, he couldn't drive me all the way to the Gray exit, so he dropped me on the highway.

Lots of people stopping at Busy Bee. People working there didn't tell me anything as I was looking for a ride. 

Regarding the season, most cars were full or heading East/South, however people very friendly and even received a few bucks.

Finally got a ride from 3 Mexican men driving all the way to MS, who got convinced when I spoke to them in Spanish.

Silent ride, animated only by the Mexican radio.

Good shoulder, refused many rides because they didn't go that far.

Ended up getting a ride from a surfer/musician who was very concerned of my safety and drop me a few exits further than where he was going to improve my chances to get a next ride.

First car stopped. 

Russian immigrant with a fancy expensive car. 

Short ride, as I was going from a Marina to another one to find a boat to reach the Bahamas.

Buc-ee's, so many people to ask for a ride. Not been bothered by the station employees, probably didn't even realize I was there regarding the size of the place.
People were friendly, but mostly going North.
End up finding a guy going to Florida who accepted to do a detour to drop me where I was spending the night in exchange of some gas money.
First couple I asked picked me up after saying no first. They made room specifically for me to get inside and offered me a nice ride along the country.
Ride all the way back to Portland, great spot for going north
not a lot of traffic but good vibes. cool guy from Hot Springs let me stay the night on the way to St Regis
Long and plenty of shoulder , got a ride quick into crescent city
Ride to where the 20 and 101 intersect
Ask for rides here, lots of home bums in area , locals not rlly down for it
Asked for awhile got a ride to Tracy talking about relationship problems and driving 100 in a Corvette
Ride from Arabic guy driving 100 and eating khat
Arco not a bad place to ask, ride from a gay porn star
Asked around here and got a ride to Bakersfield
Quick ride into slabs
Caught a ride with an Armenian trucker who found me a Russian wife to El Centro
Got really lucky first person I asked dropped me a bit past Tucson
Asked around at the gas station and got a ride to El paso
Ride west for a couple hours
Walking with God , asked for a ride at the shell
Side of the highway , ride from a Turkish trucker with very little English
Asked around and got a ride fairly quick, be cautious that a lot of people in Texas carry guns though
Lots of room to stop , got a ride all the way to Beaumont
Picked up quick to Lafayette
Got a ride quick , busy area + traffic from airport
Asking around for rides here got us one to rest stop before Gainesville
Good spot to ask for rides going north or west. Got one to tampa
Ride north from grandpa and grandson hot boxing van
Big shoulder room to stop, decent amount of traffic but most of it seems to be going north, got a ride to the rest area 10 min down
Good place to ask for rides, got one to palm bay quick
Got a quick ride to the next exit where there was a truck stop

The traffic is two-laned, but there are lots of spots for drivers to pull over and you have high visibility and lots of time for people to see you
I got picked up really quickly by a very obviously high teenager. She told me that she's seen people hitchhiking here relatively often but she only picked me up since I was young. I have a feeling a lot of people here are like her lol
Ride to Columbia in the bed of a pickup
Decent amount of traffic got a quick ride into Spartanburg
Good shoulder lots of room to stop , heading east
Lots of home bums around here, someone told me locals are generally sketched about hitchhikers due to that. Short ride to Erwin
Short ride to Johnston city nice shoulder
Got a quick ride to Johnston city
Room to stop, got lucky with a ride 4 hrs south
7-11 good spot to hang and ask for rides. Locals are chill and nice
Got dropped here, waited on the shoulder of i66 got picked up pretty quick
Ride out of DC West, illegal but enough room on shoulder to stop, got picked up quick

good vis, semi dangerous if on street (fast traffic going towards 101, slower turning towards 298. decent visibility especially with sign. lots of space for cars to pullover. did not try asking at chevron gas but prob wouldnt be too bad?
Lots of cars and truckers passing through, got a ride to outside of Philly on Jersey side and took transit into town
Good spot to get back to I-5, not much use for anything long term I imagine. Lots of traffic and big shoulder.
Was pretty late and was just hanging out asking for rides. Ended up catching one to Newark and then took transit into NYC
Big shoulder room to stop, mostly local rides but should still get you 20-30 miles
Big shoulder room to pull over easily after stop light, mostly local rides it seems
Picked up right away by a nice German guy with a fancy car, thumed by the on ramp.
Got picked up by the first car I asked in the gas station, two nice South American guys. Slightly shady walking to the gas station from downtown Ft. Myers, probably because it was night.
Room to stop , lots of tourists from bar harbor won't stop for ya, but locals might, ask at the gas station to. Got a ride to ellensworth
Got a ride to the MAX station in Gresham pretty quick. Good vibes on 84 coming into Portland.
Good spot for a hitch into Montpelier
Fine as far as Interstate hitching goes. Idaho can be tough with the cops but luckily a van pulled over headed to Boise.
Quick lift to Glenn's Ferry from a guy who'd been living there since the 80s but leaves for LA every October because he hates the cold.
Short wait and the guy that picked me up took me right to my destination in south Jordan.
Short ride to Wanship. Be careful because the off-ramp and the on-ramp are a mile apart on 80 west. I ended up standing on the freeway.
Nice people in Utica. Eventually a guy named Seth stopped. Doordashing and took me to the Interstate in York.
Short ride to Omaha. Probably not worth holding out for something better.
Good commuter ride going to Council Bluffs
Tons of people stopped to say their car was too full. Good vibes. Friday and Saturday 11-2 you might see a church group giving out food for donations. Hot dogs :)
Last winter used this spot, the wait was like an hour. Fickle. Most traffic is going into Boston obv.
Very dead ramp but you never can tell. Ride from a landscaping guy all the way to Desoto. Watched the sun set over the endless corn.
Ride from a nice couple who weren't going anywhere and took me a couple miles.
First ride in Iowa from a geologist dude to Iowa city. I felt bad I didn't have more time to spend in Iowa City as it sounds like a cool spot.
Local couple picked me up was very talkative. Said they only listen to CDs and mostly eat beans and hot dogs since Trump got elected.
Short ride to Rule from a guy who does tree maintenance for roads and power lines. Complaining about property owners who don't want their trees to be removed.
Ride to Aspermont from a guy headed to Abilene for a cornhole tournament. He had to stop at the liquor store because he doesn't throw as well when he's sober.
Short ride from an oil field guy to Jayton. He's got 7 kids out here. Starts work every day at 4:00. Wakes up at 3:30.
Plenty of nice people in west Texas, you might just have to wait awhile. Lots of local rides on 380 because most of the long distance traffic is down on I-20 at that point.
I-25 in this part of Colorado is VERY dead. Best bet is to stand on the interstate. Toward evening there were maybe two or three cars per minute. Eventually a guy stopped going to Raton.
Not a bad spot. Caught a ride going all the way past Pinedale

Started at the gas station nearby flying a sign, almost got a ride to KC but didnt work out, eventually moved to the onramp and got picked up in 30- an hour. on 70, decent amount of people getting on east, this guy seemed keen to take hitchers.

Plenty of shoulder if you walk a little past the light. Cars are going fast, but!, they can see you at a distance and the ones caught at the light have even more time to consider pulling over. I caught a ride all the way to Colorado from here.
Local traffic for the most part up here. Short ride from a dude headed home. I left my lucky hat in his car / - :
September 2024, not easy but there are still kind and hospitable people in New York state  :)
September 2024, 11:20 a.m.
September 2024, 17:30, a kind old man stopped
September 2024, 15:30, hitchhiking in USA is difficult, but New York State and New England are some of the best areas
Many cars, great spot to pull off.
Quick ride to the gas station from a couple of highschoolers.
Slow hitching in Tupelo
Slow morning hitch. Got a ride from a preschool teacher going to Lewes.
Lots of traffic on Rt 1 but Delaware residents are a little shy. Thumbed a Tesla to Odessa.
The spot is pretty good. Slower traffic and good pullout. The cops stopped just after the driver did, second time this happened to us in NJ. They let us all go and told us not to walk on the freeway.

The spot is pretty good for a freeway hitch. Cops stopped because they heard reports of a dirt bike on the freeway. We didn't have a dirt bike but they advised us not to hitchhike on the interstate and they drove us to the Wawa out by Six Flags.
Couple of hispanic guys took us to the train station at Bridgeport. We decided to take public transit the rest of the way into NY.
Lots of traffic. Eventually a kid stopped who was going to Bangor.
Ride from a Puerto Rican Uber driver. He said he never stops to help anybody but he'll help us. Got us past Harrisburg.
Ride from a guy in a pickup truck with a dog named Jolene. Brought us out past Harrisonburg then turned around.
Good spot, lots of traffic. Not too much pullout but fine. Ride from a guy going all the way to Maryland. A shame we were just going to Knoxville!
Good spot. Lot's of traffic. Took awhile for someone to bite. Got an Indian guy with Buddha on the dash going to Crossville.
Quick ride to the edge of Jonesboro. Jonesboro is tough to hitch through but we made do.
Spot was not great but this area of Arkansas just seems very hitchhiker-friendly.
Got picked up by a vet missing half his arm. Kept making weird sex jokes and calling people while steering with the half-arm. Let us off in Alpena and got us pizza from the gas station.
The light by the onramp is a great place to hitchhike. Good pullout and plenty of time to make eye contact. Got a quick ride farther into the tornado warning.

Lots of traffic, but not very easy for cars to stop.  I first tried waiting along the road, then I tried on the on-ramp and got a ride pretty quick.  I flew a sign that said “HOOKSETT/BOSTON.”  I think people often ignore people holding cardboard signs, because they assume you are just asking for money and don’t really read it, so if you do fly a sign, make the letters really big.

Walked from Carroll & Highland to Carroll & Hickory, thumbs out & finally got a ride near Hickory that took me all the way to University, asked immediately if I was dangerous and I said no. She drove me to Ave C after flipping around, and told me her mom had a break in, and her mom told (like screamed from the other room at ) the ppl breaking in that she believed in Jesus and they left !

Got a ride while hitching near the side of the road, by the light. Night ride. The dude who ended up picking me up backed up after stopping to turn right. Raised pick up truck, offered to drive me further than he did and also offered me a beer. A pretty good spot on University for going East or South, but mostly bc I was okay going either way.

Got a ride from a friend of a friend to the college of music from the environmental science building. We walked to her car before she drove me. I did not remember meeting her before, but she was super cool, & works at a dispo. Many cars passed me on Ave C & Hickory before she walked up- sometimes the ride isn't even on wheels yet.

Got picked up on the third round of traffic lights on Oak. Not a perfect spot, but like many local rides near UNT, there are many students willing to pick you up on the way home or to school. I got a ride from an Indian couple from Telangana and they offered to take me all the way past the interstate, where they were headed home. There's a little area for a car to pull in near where I hitched, but they just stayed in the street.

I've thumbed in this spot before without any luck, but have had lots of success recently. Anywhere on Ave C, there are people who will pick you up, mostly people from other countries or chill UNT students. I got a ride from a UNT worker from India to Bruce Hall where he turned, and later that day I was here and my roommate happened to pick me up- I mention that here as it won't garner a second hitch review & and it was on the same day.  
At the music building there is also a good spot right nea
25's. Good space to pull over, light traffic at this hour. Got a ride all the way to hickory
25's. Plenty of traffic, plenty of room to stop, even the cops didnt bother me (Hitchicking is forbiden in town)
25's. Picked up fast, but I asked too late how far they were going. Good spot otherwise.
25's. Good spot, plenty of room to stop, good traffic and make sure to be far enouth from curves for good visibility.
25's. Hitched all the way to Louisville from here, but it was raining: seems I got some sort of pitty ride
25's. Several ppl stopped but a lot of short rides. Seems like a good location
25's. Decent spot geographically, but people don't seem friendly. Got a middle finger here. Good traffic.
2guys, 25's, backpacks. Tried one asking at the gas station and one sticking thumb on the side of the road. Did not work at the gas station.

2guys, 25's. Hitched near a sign showing "Bishop", on out way, and pointed at it with a stick. Did it help ? Maybe. 
Got dropped off at  interchange CA178/US395 Bus towards Ridgecrest. Probably better to have stayed on the main highway 14.
Spot ok, slow traffic at dark. Got a short ride
Pretty good but not so long rides in the area
Busy petrol station with store and fast food. Good to ask for rides.
Small petrol station good to ask people. Got quickly a ride to St. Augustine.
No car actually stopped, but this lady came to us from the nearby store parking lot and took us further. Super friendly.
Convenient spot but people don't stop. Finally got a truck driver to stop and take us right to New Orleans. Pretty awesome
Nobody seems to pickup people here, but we finally got lucky. Rode in the back of a pickup truck.
Good visibility and space to stop. We got took by a super friendly cuban family for a short ride.
Good visibility, good space for cars to stop. We dropped our sign bc it was unsuccessful and then it worked. Apparently a lot of people going for short rides there.
A lot of traffic, not a lot of people stopping. Good visibility, good space to pull over. But strong traffic, I had a hard time keeping my thumb out, no downtime to rest my arm
This is a bold spot to hitch out of town, but it worked for me. Acceptable shoulder for drivers, low speed, steady traffic. Maybe better options elsewhere
Lots of easy short rides southbound to STL. Local commuters are nice. Be clean cut if possible

Surprised this spot wasn’t here, because it’s kinda obvious, so it took me about 40 minutes which is fine for rich area like this, you are in a good visibility for drivers and it goes uphill so they slow down.
Waited about 3 hours for a ride all the way to Amarillo. Not a bad spot for Interstate hitchhiking but the sun can be pretty brutal.
This spot is a little close to the police station, but no one gave me any trouble. The shoulder is wide so people can pull off. traffic is still moving pretty slow.
Folks up here are pretty chill. They're used to giving rides to PNT Through hikers.
Everybody is going to the grand canyon. Good place.
Lots of people just going to the next town. I took one of these but it may be worth waiting longer to go further than Fredonia
Good spot. Lots of people, across from a red light which forces people to slow. Place to stop. Directly heading to I-70.
Room to pull over!
Cars are going pretty fast but there's a breakdown lane, so it can work.

Decent spot to get onto US 101, as there's a largish gravel shoulder before the on-ramp where people can stop. First car which stopped (5 mins waiting) didn't go in my direction, second one (15 mins) took me all the way to the Port Angeles area. If you're not finding a ride, there's a bus station nearby, as well as places to buy drink and food.
Nice spot. Good people. Stinky me.
Next to gas station and they see you for a long time

15-20 minutes, which is not bad, but position not really good for a hitchhike. If you will go on ramp u will see the "no pedestrian blah blah blah" sign and others. So best strategy is to stay little before it and stay on corner. There is traffic light and long way before you. So drivers have a planty of time to see you.
I wasn looking for a place to hitchhike, but a guy on a truck just stop by and ask me if I'm hitchhiking
Best spot around. Near a gas station, straight long route, awesome visibility from far.
Very few people (3-5 cars per minute) but very kind.
Got a track really fast. Next to gas station which is also good
People coming from bar harbor really often and like hitchhikers (or I'm just lucky)
Not a bad spot at all, although not much shade. Was picked up by a really kind man who took me all the way to McAllen
Pretty decent spot, lots of gas stations

The on ramp here was pretty dead, most of the traffic is going north and then either headed east or west along the 80. Eventually walked on the interstate and flew a sign there. More traffic will see you, but speed limit in this area was 70-75, so I wouldn't expect many people to stop here. The couple that picked me up said they drove past at first and then decided to come back around and pick me up. Got a straight ride to Denver though. Can't remember how long it took as I was walking along the
Not a bad spot at all - got across the whole of Arkansas in one trip and was dropped in Rockwall, Tx
Decent spot with a fair amount of traffic. Picked up by a friendly old school trucker called Hank who took us all the way to Athens, Al! One guy one girl

Sat right at the truck parking lot exit, held out my sign when I saw trucks driving out. First one that stopped said they were headed in the opposite direction, but another truck stopped a little while later and gave me a ride out. Much faster here than the on ramp and more responses.
Just before here two lines merge together, making the cats go slow, and there is space to stop
Good spot, plenty of traffic and room for cars to pull over. Bus station close by to charge phone. Free food Cafe close by as well. Next to friendship house.

Used this location prior to the disassembly of the oasis (highway overpass rest-stop). Knocked on semi-truck doors until someone offered a ride.  Gas stations still exist here, so maybe still an option, but most likely less trucks now.
Decent spot by the railroad crossing
Ski traffic, might not get you too far
Nice people, got waved at by most who just passed, good space for cars to pull off
Rochester to Niagara Falls, I was lucky i guess
This spot is Ok. Pretty typical. With a bunch of Cartel activity in the area.Yakima is a pretty rough city, so if you're passing through and heading north, try to get dropped off here.
Hitching right off of the highway might be your best bet if you get dropped off at this ramp. The road is pretty fast here, but the shoulder is wide, and the visibility is good.
The ramp is ok. Lots of room to pull off.

This spot is ok. There isn't a whole lot of traffic, but there is plenty of room to pull off. There is a good place to sit here. The other northbound ramp gets more traffic, but this ramp has better visibility, and a place to sit.
Guy who picked me up asked me to drive, then went to sleep while I was driving.

This isn't the perfect spot, but if you're stuck out here in Melissa, then it's probably your best bet. I find that the type of person that stops at Buccie's, isn't the type of person that stops for hitchhikers. 

That said, people that live in Melissa are even less likely to stop for you. I got picked up by a California transplant, that does a lot of backpacking. He was a really cool guy. He was on his way out to Texoma lake to test out some new gear.
It's a little ways out of town, but it's a pretty good spot.
Took a min to get a ride but got one all the way into Swansea

I walked here from Fife. It was well worth the walk.

There is a ton of room for cars to pull off. A retaining wall partially blocks the view for some of the oncoming traffic, but they still have plenty of time and room to stop. I got picked up really quickly by a guy that ended up buying a bus ticket for me to portland, so I'd call it a win.
People were chill about it but it took a few cars. Got a ride from a construction worker heading into San Fran

call my mom. email me for her number with where youre at, if youre stuck, etc. she lives in town but often goes to phoenix, vegas, indio or santa barbara depending on what she's doing.
abolition666@protonmail.com
let me know you got this info from hitchwiki
Truck stop
Despite the dark, I got a lift to Princeville so I could shop without having to get off the bus and wait and hour for the next one.
In front of post office/bus stop. Get a ride to haena or kalalau. Wait 20-30 minutes.

Quick ride from a trucker who was goin to SD. Got off in Grand Island. He was watching South Park while he drove. Gave me two sausage egg McMuffins that he had just bought but insisted that he had no interest in ever eating.
Got a ride all the way to Cheyenne from here pretty easily. Hitching the midwest after college move-in weekends is a good thing.

Decent spot. Took about two hours to find a ride. Police drove by a few times but didn't bother me. Hitching in PA is against the law but seems to be rarely enforced. Another driver gave me $20 too before I found my ride.

I HH here to Harrisburg (about 1-1.5 hours ride).
It is possible for the cars to stop on the on ramp to pick you up. 

How to get here?
It is a bit tricky I was partly HH and walking from the Allentwon Greyhound bus terminal. Takes some time but the spot is good. Trafic is not too much but cares are not very fast since there is a redlight nearby to slow them down
Probably just really licked out but got a ride to Ashland within 10-15 minutes.
The spot seems perfect, but I was waiting for over 2 hours and nobody would stop. Maybe I was out of luck. I went to the airport blvd ramp and got picked after 40 mins.
Good spot. only spent about 30 minutes here before i got a ride. got harassed by some coppers, but they didn't come back to check if i was still there.

There is plenty of time for people to see you and stop, and there is a lot of room for cars and trucks to pull off. I leaned against one of the highway sign poles and waited. Wasn't that long of a wait.
Southbound. Not the worst spot ever. Cars and trucks stop through here on their way to/from Chico or for gas & fast food.

I waited 8 hrs with no ride. I can see how this would be a good spot, but the traffic was mostly teslas, BMWs, and Lexus'.

Maybe I just picked a bad day to hitch.
Got out surprisingly fast. Right under the arches of the I5 bridge
Going southbound, this is your spot. Good viewing distance, good Portland folks. Making a sign may be helpful. Look for the hippie vans!
Got a ride to Trinidad relatively quick

Arcata's a cool town and all, but you can't hitch north out of it. We tried for nearly 6 hours, and a few people stopped and told us it was a tough hitch, but nobody picked us up. (we had a sign for Crescent City) You're better off on the side of the 5, even though cars are going really fast there. People are nice, but nobody's going anywhere.
If you'reheading east, go for any ride going to Blue Lake or Willow Creek -- both have better 299 hitch spots and will get you outof the local traffic zone
Evidently a popular spot (signs strewn around, other hitchers joined us while we waited) but traffic was almost entirely local, to McKinleyville etc.  Eventually took a ride to Trinidad.

A few folks stopped, but they were pretty short rides. I got a few kick downs. Smokes and donuts. The ramp has a curb, but there is a wide shoulder on the highway. Although traffic is moving pretty quickly, and no one seemed to want to stop.

I left the spot because of construction. I agree, it seems like the other ramp in town may be better for both north and south bound traffic. Although if someone offers a ride out to Pleasant Valley (north), you could ask to get dropped off at the Manzanit

Going north, we were told this is much better than the other Grant's Pass onramp, but the shoulder on the onramp is pretty narrow and we waited two hours without anybody stopping.  Probably better to ask people at the adjacent gas stations.

I waited about 30 minutes on a Sunday afternoon (just before sunset) with a sign that said Victorville.  Getting a lift farther could be difficult because most traffic is "local," leaving Ontatio Mills from a day of shopping.  To get lifts from here, you'll have to be relatively clean looking.

People turning on 141 see you from far and have time to make a decision. Was afraid first of having no cars passing by, but there were a few stills. 

Got lucky with a ride going far up North.
Curious driver with a lot of questions, we quickly stopped in a bar to say hi to one of his friends, he got me there a bowl of delicious clam chowder soup.

Brought here by my host in Bozeman.
Okay shoulder and not a lot of people actually going through the ramp.
Had an offer for a ride to Manhattan after only a few seconds. I declined, as it was too short.

Had to wait another half hour to get a ride from Laif to Three Forks. He was on his way to give flight classes.
When he dropped me he offered to get me a sandwich and insisted on giving me a Bible.

Cops passed but didn't say anything.

Three gas stations with low traffic, easy even for one person to keep an eye on all of them and ask around. 
Maverik had the most cars, but I got asked to stop after 10-15'. The clerk offered to call the local church to see if someone could give me a ride to Pocatello.

Never heard back from this, but I end up having a ride from Valory. Full of energy, she always has a story to tell and used to pick up people!
At first, she saw me and give me a huge bag of cereals and left to bring me back a

Got kicked out of the closest Maverik gas station in less than a minute by an employee.

The on-ramp was perfect, but highway patrol pulled over after 10-15'. Apparently, they got called I was getting in front of vehicles (I was not).

They seem bothered bc they had to ask me to leave and couldn't offer me any alternative to keep going. I went on the road before the traffic light. They said nothing bc it was out of their jurisdiction. Got a ride soon after that from Verona, a retired woman h

All the room to stop, but most of the traffic wasn't going on the Interstate.

Got a ride from a man in his thirties, heading to work.

Maybell offers nothing during the winter. Only restaurant is closed and only one gas station open. Very low traffic.

Got offered a ride to Rocky Springs, WY after 5', but not my way.

Despite excellent situation on the only road going through town (great shoulder, visibility and cars slowing down), I walked out to get potential traffic coming from CO 318. Bad idea, as the time of my wait, no cars went my direction coming from this way.

Got a ride finally by a young Mormon who saw me earl

Technically good spot who allow asking at the gas station and panhandle the car passing US40 at the same time. The issue is this road leads to nothing, so not much traffic. Clerk working there is very nice, we had a good chat.

The day before, walked all the way there through main road in town and hitchhiked there an hour until sun sets. Not a lot of traffic and plenty of people giving me mean looks. 
The only car who stopped was to tell me to try to go further to increase my chances.

Next

Clear area, can be seen from far away. Plenty of space to stop, but cars were driving fast.

A latino family stopped and drove me to the  next town. Offered me coffee and the driver gave me her number in case I needed a place to stay.
Was too early for that tho

Still in pitch dark, trying to reach the Hotsprings.

And Matt stopped !

He passed me going downhill, and came back thinking that he couldn't let me there alone. 
Also offered me to host me in case I was in need.

Middle of nowhere. I started walking South towards Rollinsville and rising thumb&sign each time a car would pass me by (not a lot).

A couple who passed me going the other way came back to pick me up.
They keep driving further towards I-70. They actually were the folk/Rock-Americana band Strangebyrds. We talked about US politics, travels, art, etc. 

A very nice ride indeed !

Small town, with a good spot to hitchhike on the road and asking directly at the gas station.

Got offered a ride by someone who stopped at the gas station and saw me first with my sign. He has a hitchhiker friend so it motivates him to stop and help.
Offered to hang out in Denver while I'm around.

There's a jail few miles up north, might reduce chance of rides from local or depending on your looks.

Good traffic. I got a first car stopping after 15 minutes, but wasn't going far enough.

Finally, Joe, an old vet in a cool Cadillac staying at Buena Vista for winter.  

Great music on board and heated seats.

Friendly traffic, but didn't stop that much. Met my first panhandler of my trip n the Walmart parking lot.

Got finally a ride in a pickup bed.
Lots fun but quite cold.

Got kicked out of the close Buc-ee's.

Nice ramp with enough space.

A Georgian delivery man gave me a ride on his way to LA. Spent the ride talking with him in Russian through translator. 
He would have brought me to Las Vegas, NM, if he didn't have the work tracker on his van. 

Offered me money, water bottles snacks and an external battery, and to meet him in LA when I'll be there as well !

Dropped at the close gas station by my Dallas host. Very nice people working there, but no cars.

Went on the road, large shoulders.

Got a ride from someone who came back to pick me up, a retired man living in Decatur. 
He agreed to drive a few extra miles to drop me directly on US287 as I could continue heading to Wichita Falls.

He let me draw my next sign in his car because of how windy it was outside.
Strong rains, got a short ride from a local, trying to get closer to Dallas to find some public transportation to reach Downtown.
